content.description: Hard moves on an upgraded bolt lead to some great gear in a horizontal and an interesting bulge finish.
content.protection: Bolts and gear, cams purple, green, red, yellow.
content.location: The Tower of Tiers is located on the back side of the Stones and to the south toward Windy Point.  To reach it park on the left just past Geology Vista near a green block shaped face. Work around the base and drop down the back side of the ridge.  Starts on the short uphill side of the tower.

content.description: Funky start to a short protectable chimney or a solid feeling but R rated layback left of the chimney.  Then you are into discontinuous cracks leading to very thin and tenuous face/slab climbing.
content.protection: Good protection.  Single set of cams from #1 micro cam to blue Camalot single set of stoppers three bolts
content.location: Park in first parking area past Geology Vista on the right side of the road.  Drop down and hike up the road next to the retaining wall 100 yards.  From the top of the flat rocks find anchors and rap in or climb down around the down road end of the cliff.  We had two ropes and rapped in.  The climb is the second slot left of 19th Nervous Breakdown.  It is undercut and the slot is big enough to chimney if you choose to do it that way.

content.description: A classic old school route done before sticky rubber.  This climb has a slightly awkward start with good pro up to a fixed pin.  Laybacking and stemming on less than positive holds and getting pro in make it an adventure.  One of the old fixed pins is gone and you will need a 0 cam unit or grooved stoppers to protect moves about a body length above the fixed pin.
content.protection: Light rack to green or yellow camalot with stoppers and a 0 micro cam being really helpful.  Better yet bring your fearless brain and don't fall.
content.location: Drop down from the pullout and walk along the base of the retaining wall to the top of the cliff about 100 yards.  Rap in from anchors at the top or walk down on the down road end.  We had two ropes and set one up for rappelling in.

content.description: Steep face to a ledge at the base of a thin finger crack.  A final bolts brings you to the big roof traverse to the left.  The finish involves a thin hold at the lip and spooky reach to a good hold right below the anchors.
content.protection: bolts and gear to a yellow camalot.  Take dobles on blue Metolius micro cams and some stoppers.
content.location: On the west face above a small deep cave.

content.description: East facing walls just off the road.
